translations: （议员在议会中就政府的行为或政策提出）质询；质问

sentences.sentence: But whereas most first-person narratives ask us to identify with the narrator – we become this 'I' who is telling the story – this one also interpellates us as 'you'.
sentences.translation: 尽管大多数第一人称的叙述要求我们认同叙述者，即我们成为这个正在讲故事的“我”，但是《泄密的心》还把我们当作“你们”来质问。
